channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [PDFBOX-5485] Stackoverflow writing out a subset of PDF pages - COSWriterObjectStream
item.description:
Version:  org.apache.pdfbox:pdfbox:3.0.0-alpha3

 

In a subset of PDFs I process, I cannot extract a range of PDF pages and write them out to a new PDF.   ( As part of test code )

Here's the Kotlin code I use 

fun extractPages(documentName: String, fromPage: Int, toPage: Int) : Path {
   val pdfFile = Paths.get("data", "input", "PDFS", "${documentName}.pdf")
   val pdfPagesFile = Paths.get("data", "input", "PDFS", "${documentName}_Page_$fromPage-$toPage.pdf")        
   val pdfDoc = org.apache.pdfbox.Loader.loadPDF(pdfFile.toFile())
   val pageExtractor = PageExtractor(pdfDoc, fromPage, toPage)        
   val pdfPages = pageExtractor.extract()
   pdfPages.save(pdfPagesFile.toFile())
   return pdfPagesFile
}

It doesn't occur in all PDFS... maybe 10-20% of the PDFs I use. 

 

The a slice of the stack trace is 

java.lang.StackOverflowError
    at java.base/java.util.HashMap.tableSizeFor(HashMap.java:380)
    at java.base/java.util.HashMap.<init>(HashMap.java:453)
    at java.base/java.util.LinkedHashMap.<init>(LinkedHashMap.java:347)
    at java.base/java.util.HashSet.<init>(HashSet.java:162)
    at java.base/java.util.LinkedHashSet.<init>(LinkedHashSet.java:154)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.util.SmallMap.entrySet(SmallMap.java:380)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.cos.COSDictionary.entrySet(COSDictionary.java:1225)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.compress.COSWriterObjectStream.writeCOSDictionary(COSWriterObjectStream.java:336)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.compress.COSWriterObjectStream.writeObject(COSWriterObjectStream.java:230)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.compress.COSWriterObjectStream.writeCOSArray(COSWriterObjectStream.java:319)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.compress.COSWriterObjectStream.writeObject(COSWriterObjectStream.java:226)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.compress.COSWriterObjectStream.writeCOSDictionary(COSWriterObjectStream.java:341)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.compress.COSWriterObjectStream.writeObject(COSWriterObjectStream.java:230)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.compress.COSWriterObjectStream.writeCOSDictionary(COSWriterObjectStream.java:341)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.compress.COSWriterObjectStream.writeObject(COSWriterObjectStream.java:230)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.compress.COSWriterObjectStream.writeCOSArray(COSWriterObjectStream.java:319)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.compress.COSWriterObjectStream.writeObject(COSWriterObjectStream.java:226)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.compress.COSWriterObjectStream.writeCOSDictionary(COSWriterObjectStream.java:341)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.compress.COSWriterObjectStream.writeObject(COSWriterObjectStream.java:230)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.compress.COSWriterObjectStream.writeCOSDictionary(COSWriterObjectStream.java:341)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.compress.COSWriterObjectStream.writeObject(COSWriterObjectStream.java:230)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.compress.COSWriterObjectStream.writeCOSArray(COSWriterObjectStream.java:319)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.compress.COSWriterObjectStream.writeObject(COSWriterObjectStream.java:226)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.compress.COSWriterObjectStream.writeCOSDictionary(COSWriterObjectStream.java:341)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.compress.COSWriterObjectStream.writeObject(COSWriterObjectStream.java:230)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.compress.COSWriterObjectStream.writeCOSDictionary(COSWriterObjectStream.java:341)

As I mentioned, hits some PDFs, not all.

I legally cannot share the original source PDFs but it looks like a recursive loop in writeCOSDictionary and writeObject in COSWriterObjectStream.
item.environment: MacOS, but likely not OS specific.
item.summary: Stackoverflow writing out a subset of PDF pages - COSWriterObjectStream

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Could you try with a current snapshot to see whether this has been fixed recently?
https://repository.apache.org/content/groups/snapshots/org/apache/pdfbox/pdfbox-app/3.0.0-SNAPSHOT/

Hi tilman ,

yep, still occurs.

I downloaded the latest source and built it locally.

 

I even tried a couple of fix/hack attempts in org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.compress.COSWriterObjectStream#writeObject to avoid 

recursion eg.

            if (object == base) {
                return;
            }

but that led to other issues eg.

Caused by: java.io.IOException: Page tree root must be a dictionary
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfparser.COSParser.checkPages(COSParser.java:1366)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfparser.PDFParser.initialParse(PDFParser.java:140)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfparser.PDFParser.parse(PDFParser.java:180)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.pdfparser.PDFParser.parse(PDFParser.java:154)
    at org.apache.pdfbox.Loader.loadPDF(Loader.java:434)

regards,

Owen

Ah, I think I can at least reproduce this with one of your PDFs after running my code through all the PDFs in your repo.

 

Try pdfbox/pdfbox/target/test-classes/input/PDFBOX-3110-poems-beads.pdf as a source document.

And try loading pages 1-1 or 1-2 and write them back out eg.

  val pdfDoc = org.apache.pdfbox.Loader.loadPDF(pdfFile)
  if (pdfDoc.pages.count > 1 ) {
      println("Found PDF with ${pdfDoc.pages.count} pages : $pdfFile")
      val pageExtractor = PageExtractor(pdfDoc, 1, 1)                    
      val pdfPages = pageExtractor.extract()
      pdfPages.save(xmlFile)
  }

I've had a little time to create a failing unit test within PDFBox now.

Add the following test method into org.apache.pdfbox.pdfwriter.COSWriterTest, which reuses a PDF you already have in the repo.

It fails (at least for me) with a StackOverflow.

Just in case it's JDK specific, I'm running Amazon corretto version 1.8 on a MacBook Pro.

 

 

    @Test
    void testPDFBox5485() throws Exception
    {
        File pdfFile = Paths.get("src", "test", "resources", "input", "PDFBOX-3110-poems-beads.pdf").toFile();
        File pdfFilePages = Paths.get("src", "test", "resources", "input", "PDFBOX-3110-poems-beads-pages_2-2.pdf").toFile();        
        try (PDDocument pdfDocument = Loader.loadPDF(pdfFile)) {
            PageExtractor pageExtractor = new PageExtractor(pdfDocument, 2, 2);
            try (PDDocument pdfPages = pageExtractor.extract()) {
                pdfPages.save(pdfFilePages);        // Throws StackOverflow in here
            }
        }
    }

 

regards,

Owen
Yeah I can confirm that. (Saving into a ByteArrayOutputStream()).

Commit 1903345 from lehmi@apache.org in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1903345 ]

PDFBOX-5485: preserve origin key

Commit 1903348 from lehmi@apache.org in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1903348 ]

PDFBOX-5485: avaoid StackOverflowException

Commit 1903349 from lehmi@apache.org in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1903349 ]

PDFBOX-5485: add test as proposed by Owen McGovern
omcgovern thanks for the report and the input especially the test. I've fixed the Stackoverflow. You might check the fix using the next upcoming snapshot

Thanks tilman  and lehmi ,

I can confirm that fix works.   I pulled the latest trunk code and ran my code against all unencrypted PDFs in your repo, and no StackOverflow.

Looks good !
omcgovern Thanks for the fast feedback, set to resolved
